facts: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.
It is used for creating the structure of a webpage.
HTML5 is the latest version and comes with new features like native video and audio support.
CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.
It is used for styling and layout of web pages.
CSS3 introduced features like animations, transitions, and responsive design capabilities.
C is a general-purpose programming language created by Dennis Ritchie at Bell Labs in 1972.
It has a strong influence on many other programming languages, such as C++, C#, and Objective-C.
The Linux operating system kernel, many embedded systems, and various other applications are written in C.
C++ is an extension of the C programming language with object-oriented programming features.
It was developed by Bjarne Stroustrup at Bell Labs.
C++ is widely used in game development, system/software development, and embedded firmware.
Java was developed by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems and released in 1995.
It is known for its slogan 'Write Once, Run Anywhere' (WORA), meaning that compiled Java code can run on any device with Java support.
Java is widely used in web development, mobile application development (Android), and enterprise-level applications.
